text:
When trying to create a ToC using page-number-citation and text-align="end" the 
page numbers do not seem to be aligned along the "end" of the table cell.

This only seems to occur when the ToC is at the beginning of the document.

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Use readme.fo 
2. Copy and Paste the licence a couple times.
3. Change the id of the new licence copies
4. Add new entries for the licences in the Toc (at the end of the fo)
5. Copy the ToC to the beginning of the document (before the first block in 
fo:flow)
6. Run FOP with it...
(I've created this file and will try to attach it...)
creator: ssander@microstrategy.com
ssander@microstrategy.com
text:
Created attachment 65
FO and PDF with modified readme file.

This is the prototype of the end aligned forward reference page number
citation bug.
FOP reserves some space for forward reference page number citations, which
is filled on being resolved. The area actually needed by te page number may
be quite different, therefore the misalignments.
creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
